page.title: 15HISTORY OF LYMM'S EDUCATION
page.content: From about 1600 to 1958, Lymm Grammar School was the main provider of education in the Lymm district.In the beginning it was very small, only about 25 pupils, and was for boys only.Two sites were used.One by St. Mary's Church, the other where the Health Centre is today.In 1938 the school moved to premises on Grammar School Road.In 1902 the school became coeducational.The school grew in size and became dependant on Cheshire county council.In 1949 it became a voluntary controlled Grammar School. In 1958 Lymm county Secondary School was opened on the Grammar School site as the Grammar School moved to a new site in Oughtrington Lane.From there the two schools went their seperate ways until in 1978 they both started on the road to comprehensive reorganisation.The two schools
